intro: Zehneria erythrocarpa, commonly known as the red-fruited zehneria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. Its most distinctive feature is its bright red, fleshy berries, which are edible and attract various wildlife. Zehneria erythrocarpa is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
